INTRODUCTIONTHIS PAPER PRESENTS A DATA-DRIVEN PROBABILITY INTEGRALMETHOD FOR PRICING FIXED-TERM DERIVATIVE CONTRACTS.
E. TAIL MODELINGTHE DESCRIBED SMOOTHED QR MODEL (7), (8), (10), (11) INTER-POLATES THE AVAILABLE DATA.
THE EVT METHODS FOR TAIL ESTIMATION ARE PEAKSOVER THRESHOLD (POT) AND THE BLOCK MAXIMA.

POSSIBLE SHORTAGES OF THEFORWARD CONTRACT ARE FILLED BY PROCURING THE DEFICIT AMOUNT ATTHE SPOT ELECTRICAL POWER MARKET, WHICH CAN BE RATHER VOLATILE.IF THE FORWARD CONTRACT PROVIDES A SURPLUS OF THE POWER, THEOVERPAYMENT CANNOT BE RECOVERED.THIS SECTION APPLIES THE DEVELOPED METHODOLOGY TO A FEWPROBLEMS RELATED TO THE DESCRIBED DAY-AHEAD ELECTRICITY PRO-CUREMENT SETUP.

THIS CONTRACT PRICING IS THEN APPLIED TODEMONSTRATE PROCUREMENT POLICY OPTIMIZATION IN SECTION V-E.A. MODEL FOR DAY-AHEAD FORWARD CONTRACTLET PT BE THE LOAD DEMAND AND ΠT THE SPOT PRICE AT HOUR T. THERESPONSE VARIABLES YP,T AND YΠ,T IN THE DATASET (1) ARE INDEXEDBY THE NUMBER OF HOURS T ELAPSED SINCE THE START OF THE DATACOLLECTION AND AREYP,T = LOG (PT/P0) , (66)YΠ,T = LOG (ΠT/Π0) , (67)WHERE THE LOG-LOAD IS NORMALIZED BY P0 = 1 GW AND THE LOG-PRICE BY Π0 = $1/MWH.
REGRESSORS ZT IN (66), (67) INCLUDE6 INDICATORS FOR WEEK DAYS, 11 FOR CALENDAR MONTHS, AND 3 FORHOLIDAYS, AS WELL AS 24-HOUR LAGGED LOG-LOAD AND LOG-SPOT PRICEFOR A TOTAL OF 23 REGRESSORS.
THE DATA COVERS A TIME RANGEFROM JANUARY 2011 TO DECEMBER 2013 WITH SAMPLING INTERVAL OFONE HOUR, N = 26 280 SAMPLES AT ALL.
THE TRAININGSET INCLUDES THE DATA FROM JANUARY 2011 TO DECEMBER 2012, THETOTAL OF 17 520 SAMPLES.

PLOT OF QUANTILE REGRESSION LOAD FORECAST.2013, WHICH CONTAINS 8760 TIME SAMPLES, IS USED FOR VALIDAT-ING THE MODEL SECTION V-B AND THE MODEL-BASED POLICIES INSECTIONS V-C AND V-E.THE DATA-DRIVEN METHODS OF SECTION III WERE APPLIED TOESTIMATE TWO PROBABILISTIC MODELS FROM THE DATA: THE MODELOF THE FORM (27) FOR THE LOG LOAD YP,T (66) AND THE MODEL (28) FORTHE LOG PRICE YΠ,T (67).

THE MODELS USE QUANTILE GRID (10) WITHM = 99 AND SPACING ΔQ = 0.01 SPANNING FROM QL = RL = 0.01TO QR = RR = 0.99.SELECTION OF SMOOTHING PARAMETERS ʌ AND Μ IS DISCUSSED INSECTION III-D. MORE DETAIL ON PARAMETER TUNING FOR A CLOSELYRELATED APPLICATION EXAMPLE CAN BE FOUND IN [35].
IN BOTH DATAFIT PROBLEMS (11), FOR (66) AND (67), THE SMOOTHING PARAMETERSWERE SET TO ʌ = 5 · 105, Μ = 5 · 105FOR 2, 3, AND 6-HOUR AHEADFORECASTS AND ʌ = 106, Μ = 5 · 105FOR ALL OTHER HOURS.
THE OUTPUT IS DISTRIBUTIONMODEL ON QUANTILE GRID (10) DESCRIBED BY QUANTILE REGRESSIONPARAMETERS {ΒJ , ΑJ }MJ=1 IN (11), AND TAIL RATE PARAMETERS (20)AND (21).
